featured.text: What question does the passage answer? (A) How was the word “hula-hooping” derived? (B)
Modern flip-flops derive from Japanese zōris, which were often worn with socks dividing the big toe from the rest, and were typically made of rice straw.

definition.en_def: To obtain or draw a conclusion from something; to develop or originate from a source.
definition.example: We can derive useful insights from the data we collected.
